entry.title: Books I Read in 2016
entry.summary: The List isn't long. same as the last year, I was spending my last months in the military service. I think there are a couple of books missing from the list which I might forgot them for the moment of creating this post. Also I hope I to find the …
entry.content:
The List isn't long. same as the last year, I was spending my last months in the military service. I think there are a couple of books missing from the list which I might forgot them for the moment of creating this post. Also I hope I to find the time in the next year to also keep track of the useful articles since I'm mainly reading them instead of hard cover books.

Computer & Programming

  • Head First C
  • Scalable C by Pieter Hintjens
  • The Design and Implementation of the FreeBSD by Marshall Kirk McKusick (only a few chapters)

entry.title: Books I Read in 2015
entry.summary:
The List isn't long. in fact I spend the entire year in a military camp doing my final year of military service. my resolution for the year to read Books I wished to read but didn't have the time and I enjoyed reading every one of them.

Novels

  • Divergent Series …
entry.content:
The List isn't long. in fact I spend the entire year in a military camp doing my final year of military service. my resolution for the year to read Books I wished to read but didn't have the time and I enjoyed reading every one of them.

Novels

  • Divergent Series by Veronica Roth
  • Lord of the Rings by J.R.R Tolkien
  • Inferno by Dan Brown
  • The Lost Symbol by Dan Brown
  • Beloved by Toni Morrison
  • The Fault in our starts by John Green
  • The Abundance of Katherines by John Green
  • The First Man by Albert Camus

Computer & Programming

  • Clean Code by Robert C. Martin
  • Effective Python by Brett Slatkin
  • Pro Git by Scott Chacon
